Text.Value: Oh, the dog's had enough fun? Lazy mutt.
I don't think Scratch is up for it.
Poor pooch is worn out.
It's too soon - Scratch needs his rest.
Poor Scratch is tired. I should let him rest.
Poor Scratch is all worn out.
Well, Scratch? Do you scratch yourself somewhere?
The poor dog is still weary. I must give him a chance to recover.
Disobedient hound. Where is he?
Scratch is off somewhere scratching himself, I think.
Must be tired from all that running around.
Aw, did someone pet you a bit too hard, pup? I thought you liked it!
Why can't you fetch, puppy? Death is no excuse!
I think Scratch is up north. Playing in a goat-farm in Icewind Dale, of course!
I should probably free the dog - this ball won't fetch itself.
Throwing the ball around is no fun when there's no Scratch to catch it.
Might as well throw the damn thing at the post house...
I don't know what I expected - Scratch can't reach me just now.
*Sigh*
This is no fun without Scratch here.
Enough - I do believe the dog himself would be embarrassed for me. Let's go get him back.
Worth an attempt, but it would surely be quicker to just free Scratch.
I hope he remembers us.
You are right, Boo. If Scratch could see me now, he would be concerned.
Well, it was worth one last shot.

EditorData.NodeContext: Minthara: sadly; thinking of Scratch the dog, who the party left elsewhere

Text.Value: Dog? Dog! Fetch the ball. Fetch the - never mind, I'll get it.
Scratch is resting. Not sure who or what I expected would fetch that.
Better let Scratch rest up.
Lazy mutt... no, I shouldn't say that. He's a good boy.
Scratch needs a snooze. The games can wait.
I shouldn't tease our boy.
Would you prefer I wild-shape, and fight you for it?
The valiant Scratch deserves his rest. Best leave him be for another while.
Scratch. Obey my command!
Ah, I see. Scratch is playing fetch in his dreams instead.
Even good boys need a moment to catch their breath.

EditorData.NodeContext: Minthara: miffed, but not actually angry. She likes Scratch too much to be angry.

Text.Value: What, I have to go and pick it up myself? Ridiculous.
I need to break Scratch out of that kennel.
I'm just playing fetch with myself unless I go back for Scratch...
Worth a try. I really ought to free Scratch.
The pooch won't be fetching balls until I fetch him from that kennel.
We need to go get our boy back from that awful kennel.
Perhaps if I threw Boo, Scratch would come running... do not think I missed that hungry look, hound.
Thwarted again. I must see to freeing that poor dog.
Who do we need to kill to get Scratch back?
One more throw, and then we shall go and fetch Scratch from his prison.
Time to fetch Scratch from the kennels, I suppose.
Scratch was only ever meat of the lowest grade.
Even the power of a squeaky ball isn't enough to break the dog out of that kennel.
The dog's still stuck at the post house.
I suppose teleportation is beyond Scratch.
I suppose I should really free Scratch before I expect him to come running...
Scratch is cooped up at the post house. Can't wait to have him back.
Scratch is still stuck at the post house.
Blast. We left the dog to the kennels.
Scratch cannot come - he still languishes at the post house.
Scratch! Here, boy! Where is that damn dog?
Scratch is a captive of the post house still. Unless he breaks out to come and fetch...? No.
Ah - Scratch is still at the post house.
Does it have a sad squeak now? Is that even possible?
I really don't know what I thought would happen.
I hope there's balls and bones galore, wherever you are...
I didn't do this enough, when I had the chance.
Damn. I miss the furry fellow.
Here, pup.
You deserved better, boy.
I am sorry, Scratch.
Scratch reminded me of my first displacer beast. A noble creature.
No game of fetch will bring Scratch back from death.
Poor Scratch. I miss him.

EditorData.NodeContext:
Karlach: Sadly. The dog is dead, and she knows this.
SH/Halsin: sad (throwing the camp dog's ball, but the dog's dead)
Gale: bittersweet - referring to a now-dead dog.

Text.Value: I suppose I'll just pick it up myself.
Solo fetch. A miserable pastime.
Poor Scratch. I'm lucky to have met you.
I hope Scratch has a new ball to play with, wherever he is...
For old times' sake.
Why am I doing this to myself?
Gods, but you'd miss the fuss. The noise. Gods above, even the smell.
I torment myself - Scratch is not going to come.
Withers! Be a good skeleton and fetch that ball.
I know he is gone, Boo, but... perhaps this is a way of keeping him alive, no?
It's not as fun when no one brings it back.

EditorData.NodeContext:
Minthara: joking - doesn't actually expect Withers to fetch the ball she just threw
SH/Halsin: sad (throwing the camp dog's ball, but the dog's dead)
Gale: bittersweet - referring to a now-dead dog.

Text.Value: Good riddance to the dog. Who'd miss that waggy little tail...
It's not much fun alone.
You were an excellent friend, Scratch - and that's coming from a cat-lover.
I need to stop doing this to myself...
Fetch isn't much of a solo game.
I miss my dog.
Enough. This isn't helping anyone.
I hope you are happy, wherever you are.
Everyone assumes I killed the dog. I liked the dog.
Scratch, come and... oh. How could I forget he was gone, Boo?
I suppose I'd better pick it up. No one else will.

EditorData.NodeContext:
Minthara - talking to herself. Comic edge to this.
SH/Halsin: sad (throwing the camp dog's ball, but the dog's dead)
Astarion: Pretending not to be sad and failing
Gale: bittersweet - referring to a now-dead dog.

Text.Value: Well... there might have been another dog around?
Just - tossing the ball around.
I should probably fetch Scratch from the post house.
Scratch can't aid me just now - not while he's in the post house.
Scratch is a good friend. I need to get him back.
Don't know what I expected.
Too much to hope that Scratch would hear it and break free.
Of course, my canine friend cannot help just now. He remains at the post house.
Scratch is at the post house. We should organise a rescue mission.
Would you like to fetch instead, Boo?
It was worth a shot. Could have been other dogs in the area.
First he wants to fetch, now he doesn't want to fetch. Make up your mind, dog.
It's Scratch's naptime. I'll need to get that.
The ballplay can wait, I suppose.
Poor thing. He must still be tired.
All tuckered out? Me too, Scratch. Me too.
Fella must need a little shut-eye.
Take your rest then, Scratch. Eldath knows you've probably earned it more than us.
Even the most loyal of companions needs his rest. Sleep on, Scratch.
Blasted dog. You dare ignore me?
Scratch sleeps still? Boo, you will have to share with him some of your stamina-building tricks.
Must still be tired. Poor Scratch.

EditorData.NodeContext: Minthara: miffed, but not actually angry. She likes Scratch too much to be angry.

Text.Value: The dog's tired after one little game of fetch? Weak. Pathetic. Barely a good boy at all.
I guess I'll have to get that. Scratch isn't about to.
Hmm. I suppose Scratch has had enough fun and games for now.
Still too soon. Scratch is dreaming of balls and buried bones, no doubt.
No point in that. Good ol' Scratch is snoozing away.
Better get it myself.
Lazy pup! Must I fetch it myself?
Scratch deserves his rest - I can hand this without him.
Do I have to fetch it myself? This is demeaning.
If Scratch will not fetch, and Boo will not fetch, then Minsc must fetch.
If Scratch won't pick it up, I guess I will.
Can't believe the stupid dog isn't here to get the stupid ball.
Can't believe I'm going to say this, but - I miss Scratch.
I hope Scratch doesn't miss his ball, wherever he is...
It's silly... part of me felt like Scratch might still show up for his ball.
I miss you, Scratch.
Scratch should be here. With his family.
Pointless, without a pup to chase it.
Poor Scratch. I hope he is at peace.
Gah. I miss the damn dog.
I miss him, Boo.
Scratch really gave that ball life.
